telephony_line_assist_troubleshooting_pr: Troubleshooting procedure
If you still cannot receive calls after these initial checks, there may be a restriction on your network.
Check your network settings:
Do you have an operator box?
Change your firewall setting to low (check with your Internet Access Provider).
If you have your own router and/or firewall:
Deactivate the SIP/ALG Passthrough.
Authorise traffic to network 91.121.128.0/23.
On the phone terminal, press the black central button.
Go to Settings.
Go to Telephony.
Go to Send Connection.
Choose INT1 (Or your handset name).
In Connection for outgoing calls, choose IP1 or OVHcloud SIP.
Click Save.
In general, this behaviour is due to your router’s firewall being too restrictive.
First, follow these steps to modify the configuration of your phone:
Go to the following address: http://gigaset-config.com.
The page prompts you for the telephone PIN, which is 0000 by default.
Click Settings.
Click Telephony.
In the IP connection section, click Modify on line IP1.
Click Show Advanced Settings.
On the Outbound Proxy Mode line, click Always.
In the Outbound Proxy field, enter 91.121.129.159.
In the Port field, enter 5962.
Click Set and restart the handset.
If the problem persists, check the following settings:
If you have an operator box:
Change your firewall setting to low (check with your Internet Access Provider).
If you have your own router and/or firewall:
Deactivate the SIP/ALG Passthrough.
Authorise traffic to network 91.121.128.0/23.
This malfunction can occur in two situations:

The Ethernet cable is not properly connected to your base or your switch/router. Check that the cable is plugged into your switch/router and that it is plugged into the side of the Gigaset base. If the fault continues, test another cable.
There is no power to the base. Check that the cable on the back of the base is properly connected, as well as the electrical outlet. Test another power outlet if the fault persists.
This message is displayed when the handset cannot connect in DECT to your base.
There are several possible causes:
The base is not receiving power: check your electrical connection.
You have multiple DECT bases too close together (stacked, or one behind the other): space out the bases so that the DECT signal is not interrupted.
You're out of range of the base. Move closer to the base. If the handset is working, you will need to place a Gigaset Repeater here or move the base to a more optimum location.
Your handset cannot register your line on our infrastructure.
Check in the following order:

Check that the Ethernet cable is plugged into the right-hand side of your base and into your switch/router. (The button on the base must be lit in blue) Also check that your internet connection is working.
Restart the base (By switching off the power supply and switching it back on).
Check that your phone has an IP address. To do this, press the blue button on the base for one second. The handset will ring and display “IP: xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx.” Your IP must be different from 0.0.0.0.
Retrieving the phone’s private IP address:
On the base you want to configure, press the Blue button for one second.
Your handset will ring, and display the IP address of the database. For example: 192.168.1.10.
On your computer (On the same network as your database), enter the IP address written on the handset in the address bar of your browser as: http://TEL_IP./.
After entering the phone's IP address in your browser, the page will prompt you for a PIN. By default, this is 0000.
Now that you are logged in, change the address in your browser to http://TEL_IP/settings_services_eeprom_provider.html.
You will then be redirected to a configuration form.
Tick Yes on the Enable EPROM Phonebook Provider option.
Enter Company in the Provider name section
Enter Business Book in the Directory name (Private) section.
Enter the following URL in Server URL: http://pb.voip.ovh.net/sm/{{serverUrl}}/pb.cgi.
Enter FR in the Country code section.
Select ROM DATA in the Authentication mode section
In the Capabilities options, check:
Search people
Search business
Reverse search
Private network directory
Autolookup
Nickname for Private network directory
Send MAC address
Click Set.
Go to http://TEL_IP/settings_services_online_directory.html.
Check Company.
Select Enterprise.
Click Set.
When the Mute button is red, it means your phone cannot detect the network connection.
Check the power cables on your phone.
Check the network cables on your switch or router.
Generally, this problem occurs when the phone is not allocated an IP address by your DHCP server.
Check that your terminal is connected to your network and check the configuration of your router:
The keys are orange when the phone is configured but the line is unable to register.
First, check that your internet connection is working properly. Restart your device electrically.
If your line works for a few minutes after restarting, check your network settings: :
Generally on Cisco SPA devices, when your phone is not letting you receive calls but the function keys are lit green, the “Do Not Disturb” mode is enabled.
To check whether this mode is active, on the phone screen you should have the “NPD” or “DND” button displayed with a “-” after it.
To deactivate it, simply press the rightmost function key under the screen.
If the Power display is not illuminated, this means that your device is not powered properly.
The origin for this fault is located either:
In the electrical connection.
Check whether the adapter acts the same when it is plugged into another wall socket.
In the charging adapter.
Test an identical charger if you have one.
Otherwise, try testing your adapter with an identical charger: 5V - 2A.
The fact that the “Line 1” LED is off means that your OVHcloud line is not saved (authenticated) in the adapter.
In other words, the box cannot communicate with the telephone server, so there is no way for you to make or receive calls on your line.
Please ensure that this issue is not originating from your local network.
To do this, plug in the devices directly behind your router or to another network.
The fact that the “Line 1” LED is lit in solid green means that your OVHcloud line has been saved (authenticated) in the adapter.
By connecting a handset to “Phone 1”, you should be able to make and receive calls.
If you are unable to do this, check that there is not also a tone on the “Phone 2” port.
The handset may also be causing the issue.
To find out whether this is the case, test your handset on another adapter or test another handset on the adapter.
The device has detected a software or hardware issue.

To prevent this problem, connect the box directly (avoiding intermediary devices such as switches and CPL boxes) to your router or Box for up to 24 hours, in which time the adapter will have downloaded a new version of the firmware.
The device has detected an internal firmware update.

To install this update and make your device functional, connect the box directly (avoiding intermediary devices such as switches and CPL boxes) to your router or Box for up to 24 hours, while the update takes place.
You are using external power and your soundstation is not switching on.
Check that the cables are properly plugged in.
Ensure that the Ethernet cable is correctly connected, as shown on this diagram.
This message displays when the phone encounters a firmware error or when it has gone into Recovery mode.
To restore your phone, follow the procedure indicated by Gigaset on the following page: https://teamwork.gigaset.com/gigawiki/display/GPPPO/DExxx+-+Recovery+mode.
Usually, this issue occurs because “Do not disturb” mode is enabled.
To deactivate it, simply press
If incoming calls are still not working after these checks, there may be a restriction on your network.
This message displays when the phone is not connected to the network.
If your phone is working correctly but the screen still says “No network”, check that the Ethernet cable is correctly plugged into port 1 of the phone.
Refer to the following diagram.
If the message comes up again after this initial check, ensure that the Ethernet cable is correctly plugged into your switch or router.
If the phone displays this message, it means that it is unable to retrieve its configuration on our servers.
Check that your internet access is working and that your phone is correctly connected to your local network.
If the problem persists, you can also check that the device has a valid IP address.
Press the “Settings” key (the cog icon).
Press 8 to access the Information menu.
Check that the IP address displayed is different from 127.0.0.1.
If it is the same, check your network settings.
When the “Forbidden direction” button is lit in red on the phone, this means that “Do not disturb” mode is enabled.
This mode blocks incoming calls on the phone and plays the following message to the caller: “The person you are calling does not wish to be disturbed. Please try again later.”
Deactivate call forwarding by pressing “Forbidden direction”.
If your phone is not displaying an IP address, it means that it is not properly connected to the network.
View your phone’s IP address in the network configuration section: Admin → View parameters → Network configuration.
If the IP address in the IP address section is “0.0.0.0”, check your network configuration and that the DHCP has assigned an address to your phone.
This is simply a display issue with your phone.
To resolve this display issue, simply leave a message on your voicemail.
This will allow the phone to retrieve a new configuration file.
